Description: Large bowl of marl pottery with a flat base, splayed sides and squeezed rim with a highly burnished black slipped interior; the exterior is untreated and has been trimmed below the rim. There is some smoke discolouration on the exterior and drips of red slip.
Curator's comments: Like Black top red ware B12A, but it is made of marl pottery and can be compared to L16F in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
